definition: to lower a flag/to strike the colors
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: I came here at dusk when the flag was being lowered.
sentences.chinese: 我到的時候，正趕上降旗儀式。

sentences.english: After a long battle, the pirate captain hauled down his colo( u)rs.
sentences.chinese: 久戰之後，海盜船長降旗請降。

sentences.english: Every evening at sunset the flag was lowered.
sentences.chinese: 每天傍晚日落是都要降旗。

definition: honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
(in former times) upper, middle and lower army/army of right, center and left/(in modern times) the three armed services: Army, Navy and Air Force
to remove armor/to return to civilian life
